critique: This document is an executive order that modifies the exterior boundaries of several national forests in various states. It removes certain areas of land, chiefly in private ownership, from the national forests because it is no longer desirable for the United States to acquire them for national-forest purposes. The document itself is highly technical, consisting primarily of legal descriptions of land parcels (township, range, and section numbers). It does not contain overt ideological statements or policy prescriptions related to social issues, immigration, or national security. The action appears to be an administrative adjustment based on changes in land use and other practical considerations. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral. The federalism axis leans slightly towards state control, as the federal government is relinquishing control over these lands.
